title: Front Brake Master Cylinder - Installation

body.body: Front Brake Master Cylinder - Installation - PB1
Align the split line of the master cylinder clamp to the alignment mark on the upper surface of the handlebar.
Do not tighten the fixings fully at this stage.
Tighten the upper clamp fixing first to
Tighten the lower clamp fixing to
If previously removed, fit the brake fluid reservoir and bracket to the front brake master cylinder. Tighten fixing to
Connect the brake hose to the master cylinder incorporating new sealing washers.
Make sure the orientation of the brake hoses are fitted to the master cylinder at an angle of 20° +/- 5°.

body.name: Front Brake Master Cylinder hose routing_PB1_B01356_2

body.body: Angle 20° +/- 5° (brake line to front brake master cylinder)

Use only DOT 4 specification brake fluid as listed in the general information section of this manual. The use of brake fluids other than those DOT 4 fluids listed in the general information section may reduce the efficiency of the braking system leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Observe the brake fluid handling warnings given earlier in this section of the manual.
Fill and bleed the front brakes (see
Always return the lever adjuster to the original setting noted during removal. Operating the motorcycle with lever settings which are unfamiliar may lead to loss of control or an accident.
Reset the brake lever adjuster to the original setting.
Examine the system for correct operation and fluid leaks. Rectify as necessary.

It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes; you must have your authorised Triumph dealer take remedial action before you ride the motorcycle again. Failure to take remedial action may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
